# Encryption Algorithms Used by Appdome-Protected Apps

Last updated September 28, 2023 by Appdome

When you upload an Appdome-encrypted App to TestFlight before uploading to AppStore, you are prompted by Apple to indicate which encryption algorithms are implemented by your app, as shown in the figure below.

![Microsoftteams Image 81194x731](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/MicrosoftTeams-image-81194x731-1-607x366.png)

Ensure to indicate that the app is encrypted by using standard encryption.

For further details, see the article [How to manage “missing compliance” automatically on App store Test Flight?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75665696/how-to-manage-missing-compliance-automatically-on-app-store-test-flight) on StackOverflow website.

### **Related Articles**

* [Uploading a Mobile App to Appdome](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-app-security/mobile-data-encryption/uploading-a-mobile-app-to-appdome/)

If you have any questions, please send them our way at **[support.appdome.com](http://support.appdome.com/)** or via the chat window on the Appdome platform.

## Conclusion

**Need Additional Help?** 

The description above is designed to help you determine which encryption algorithms to use when uploading an Appdome-protected app to TestFlight. If you have any questions, please send them our way at [support.appdome.com](http://support.appdome.com/) or via the chat window on the Appdome platform.
